column4: Bent Over Rows (with dumbbells or household items): 4 sets of 8-10 repetitions
column5: Shoulder Press (with dumbbells or household items): 4 sets of 8-10 repetitions
column6: Pull-ups (if possible) / Bodyweight Rows: 3 sets to failure
column7: Dumbbell Chest Flyes (or bodyweight flyes): 3 sets of 10-12 repetitions

column4: Romanian Deadlifts (with dumbbells or household items): 4 sets of 8-10 repetitions
column5: Lunges (bodyweight or with dumbbells): 4 sets of 10-12 repetitions (each leg)
column6: Calf Raises (bodyweight or with household items): 4 sets of 12-15 repetitions

column3: Cardio: 30 minutes (Intense cardio such as HIIT; running in place; jumping jacks; or using cardio workout videos)
column4: Core Exercises: 15 minutes (Planks; Russian Twists; Bicycle Crunches; etc.)

column7: Incline Bench Press: 4 sets of 8-10 repetitions

column5: Side Plank: Hold for 20-30 seconds on each side
column11: Leg Raises and Flutter Kicks (5 minutes)
column12: Leg Raises: Lie on your back lift legs towards the ceiling lower them slowly without touching the ground: 2 sets of 6-8 reps
column13: Flutter Kicks: Lie on your back lift legs off the ground alternate kicking legs up and down in small controlled motions: 2 sets of 15-20 seconds
column16: Plank with Knee to Elbow: From plank position bring right knee to right elbow then switch to left knee to left elbow continue alternating for 6-8 reps on each side
column19: Side Plank with Hip Dips: Hold side plank position dip hips towards the ground and back up: 6-8 reps on each side
column20: Russian Twists: Sit on the ground with knees bent rotate torso side to side: 2 sets of 10-12 reps (each side)
column22: Strength Training: Squats: 4 sets of 8-10 repetitions
column23: Romanian Deadlifts (with dumbbells or household items): 4 sets of 8-10 repetitions
column25: Military Press (with dumbbells or household items): 4 sets of 8-10 repetitions

column4: Single Leg Stance: Stand behind a sturdy chair and hold onto it for support. Lift one foot off the ground and balance on the other foot for 10-15 seconds. Repeat on the other side
column5: Heel-to-Toe Walk: Take small steps forward placing the heel of one foot directly in front of the toes of the other foot. Walk in a straight line for a few steps then turn around and walk back
column6: Tandem Stance: Stand with one foot directly in front of the other - heel to toe - like walking on a tightrope. Hold this position for 10-15 seconds then switch sides
column7: Clock Reach: Stand on one leg and extend the opposite leg behind you. Reach both arms forward then slowly reach one arm to the side then overhead and finally to the ground while maintaining balance. Return to the starting position and switch legs
column8: Seated Forward Bend: Sit on the edge of a chair with your feet flat on the floor. Hinge at the hips and lean forward reaching your hands towards your feet. Hold for 15-30 seconds then slowly return to an upright position
column9: Neck Stretch: Sit tall in a chair and gently tilt your head to one side bringing your ear towards your shoulder. Hold for 15-30 seconds then switch sides
column10: Seated Spinal Twist: Sit on a chair with your feet flat on the floor. Twist your torso to one side placing one hand on the opposite knee and the other hand on the back of the chair for support. Hold for 15-30 seconds then switch sides
column11: Hip Flexor Stretch: Stand behind a chair and hold onto it for support. Take a step back with one foot and bend your front knee lowering into a lunge position. Keep your back knee straight and gently push your hips forward until you feel a stretch in the front of your hip. Hold for 15-30 seconds then switch sides

column3: Engage in low-intensity activities such as walking; yoga; or swimming to promote recovery and reduce muscle soreness
column4: Alternatively take a complete rest day if needed.
